title: Question 9
prompt: The graph shows the temperature change of equal amounts of five different liquids heated at the same temperature for four minutes. Which liquid has the highest specific heat?
description:
Directions: Click the one best answer to each question.

Specific heat is the amount of heat needed to raise the temperature of a substance by one degree Celsius, per unit of mass. On the same temperature heat source, a material with a high specific heat heats more slowly than a material with a low specific heat.
feedback: The text states that, when heated at the same temperature, a material with a high specific heat heats more slowly than a material with a low specific heat. Liquid A, indicated by the blue line, heats the most slowly, so it has the highest specific heat.
